original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Even a woodpecker owes his success 
to the fact that he uses his head...(2 Tim 4:5)

Our Meditation for Today:

The disciples were wondering what Jesus meant when he said, 'in a little while
you will see Me no more, and then after a little while you will see Me.' 

Jesus saw that they wanted to ask Him about this, so He said to them, "Are
you asking one another what I meant when I said, 'In a little while you will see
Me no more, and then after a little while you will see Me?' I tell you the truth
you will weep an mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief
will turn to joy."...(Jn. 16:19, 20) NIV 

Our Meditation for Today:

What a contrast between the disciples and the world! The world rejoiced while 
the disciples wept, but the disciple would see Jesus again (in three days) and
rejoice...

The world's values are often the opposite of God's values. This can cause Christians
to feel like misfits...BUT even if life is difficult now, one day we will rejoice...

Keep your eye on the future and on God's promises!!!

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your comforting presence.
I thank You for Your promise to always be with us and Your promise
to hear our prayers. Help me to be more patient with my eye on
the future in expectation of Your return...Amen.

Keep looking up, with your eye on the future...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts that are heavy, yet filled with hope. The world may rejoice in its fleeting pleasures, but we long for the eternal joy that comes from Your presence. Even in our moments of sorrow and struggle, we cling to the promise that one day, we will see You face to face and our hearts will overflow with unending joy. Lord, strengthen our faith and keep our eyes fixed on the future You have prepared for us. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The poorest of all men is not the man without
a cent but the man without a dream...Pro. 29:18a

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus said to His disciples, "Though I have been speaking figuratively, a time is coming
when I will no longer use this kind of language but will tell you plainly about My Father...

In that day you will ask in My name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your
behalf...

No, the Father Himself loves you because you have loved Me and have believed that 
I came from God... (Jn. 16:25-27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus is talking about a new relationship between the believer and God. Before this
people approached God through priests...

After Jesus' resurrection. any believer could approach God directly. A New day has 
dawned and now all believers are priests, talking with God personally and directly.
This is what we see in Heb. 10:17-23.

We approach God, not because of our own merit, but because Jesus, our great 
High Priest, has made us acceptable to God...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the love we see described in John 3:16.
I thank You for the Sacrifice Jesus was willing to make on my behalf on the cross.
I thank You that because of that sacrifice we can now approach You without 
going before a worldly priest...I thank You for, that one on one relationship that
is ours because of Christ...Amen.

Keep looking up, we have a true friend who cares for us...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

We approach God, not because of our own merit, but because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us acceptable to God.

In that day you will ask in My name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf. No, the Father Himself loves you because you have loved Me and have believed that I came from God."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that through Your Son, Jesus, we have direct access to Your throne of grace. We no longer need to approach You through priests, but can speak to You personally, as Your beloved children. Lord, we thank You for this new relationship, where we can boldly come to You, finding mercy and grace to help us in our time of need. May we ever cherish this privilege and draw near to You with confidence, trusting in the finished work of our great High Priest. Amen.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...You can accomplish more in one hour with 
God than one lifetime with out Him...Mt. 19:26b

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus said, "A time is coming, and has come, when you will be scattered,
each to his own home. You will leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone, for My 
Father is with Me.

I have told you these things, so that in Me you may have peace. In this world
you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world...(Jn. 16:32, 33) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

As Christians, we should expect continuing tension with an unbelieving
world that is "out of sync" with Christ, His Good News, and His people.

But we can take courage because He will not abandon us...

We can expect our relationship with Christ to produce peace and comfort 
because we are "in sync" with Him...

Let us remember the ultimate victory has already been won, we can claim 
the peace of Christ in the most troublesome times...


Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, I thank you for the promise that You will never leave us 
nor forsake us. I thank You for the peace that passeth all understanding.
I thank You for the victory that You won for us on the cross...Search
my heart O God and see if their be any wicked way in me...Amen.

Keep looking up, and receive His peace...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

I have told you these things, so that in Me, you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, grateful for the peace and comfort that comes from being in sync with Your Son, Jesus Christ. Though the world may be out of sync with Your ways, we take courage knowing that the ultimate victory has already been won through Christ's sacrifice. Help us to stand firm in our faith, even in the face of continuing tension, and to find refuge in the peace that only You can provide. May we always remember that You will never abandon us, for You are our ever-present help in times of trouble. Amen.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The only preparation for tomorrow
is the right use of today...Mt. 6:34

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus prays for Himself "Father, the time has come. Glorify Your Son,
that Your Son may glorify You...

For You granted Him authority over all people that He might give eternal 
life to all those You have given to Him...

Now this is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God, and 
Jesus Christ, whom You have sent...(Jn 17:1-3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

I do not know how many times I have been asked, "How do we get eternal life?"

Here Jesus tells us clearly--by knowing God the Father Himself through His Son,
Jesus Christ...

Eternal life requires entering into a personal relationship with God in Jesus Christ.

When we admit our sin and turn away from it, Christ's love lives in us by the Holy Spirit.

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that there is no more need for sacrifices.
Lord I ask that you would forgive me for the sins I have committed and ask 
that You would help me to turn from them...Thank You once again for the gift 
of eternal life. I pray these things in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, that you may grow in your relationship with Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Now this is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom You have sent.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the truth that eternal life is found in knowing You, the one true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent. We confess our sin and our need for Your redeeming grace. Fill us with Your Holy Spirit, that we may abide in Christ and experience the fullness of life that You have promised. May our lives bear witness to the transforming power of Your love. In Jesus' name, Amen.

Eternal life requires entering into a personal relationship with God in Jesus Christ. When we admit our sin and turn away from it, Christ's love lives in us by the Holy Spirit.
subject: Eternal Life Comes Through Knowing God

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...

Jesus' prayer: "I have brought You glory on earth by 
completing the work You gave Me to do...

And now, Father, glorify Me in Your presence with the glory 
I had with You before the world began."...(Jn 17:4, 5) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Before Jesus came to earth, He was one with God...

At this point when His mission on earth was almost finished,
Jesus was asking His Father to restore Him to His original
place of honor and authority...

Jesus resurrection and ascension--and Steven's dying exclamation
(Acts 7:56) gives evidence to the fact that Jesus did return to His
exalted position at the right hand of God...

The fact that this took place is the assurance that a believer will one day
inherit eternal life...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the work that was completed
on Calvary...I thank You that the debt for my sins were paid in full.
Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed, my sins of omission
and my sins of commission. Help me Lord to walk the paths of righteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, one day He will return the same way He left...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Before Jesus came to earth, He was one with God. At this point when His mission on earth was almost finished, Jesus was asking His Father to restore Him to His original place of honor and authority. Jesus resurrection and ascension--and Steven's dying exclamation (Acts 7:56) gives evidence to the fact that Jesus did return to His exalted position at the right hand of God. The fact that this took place is the assurance that a believer will one day inherit eternal life.
original_verse_text: Jesus' prayer: "I have brought You glory on earth by completing the work You gave Me to do. And now, Father, glorify Me in Your presence with the glory I had with You before the world began."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the glory and honor You have bestowed upon Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. In obedience to Your will, He emptied Himself, taking the form of a servant, and humbled Himself to the point of death on a cross. Yet, You have highly exalted Him and given Him the name that is above every name, that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow and every tongue confess that He is Lord, to the glory of God the Father. We thank You, Lord, for this assurance of eternal life through faith in Your Son. Amen.
reflection: Before Jesus came to earth, He was one with God. At this point, when His mission on earth was almost finished, Jesus was asking His Father to restore Him to His original place of honor and authority. Jesus' resurrection and ascension—and Stephen's dying exclamation (Acts 7:56)—give evidence to the fact that Jesus did return to His exalted position at the right hand of God. The fact that this took place is the assurance that a believer will one day inherit eternal life.
subject: The Eternal Glory of Christ Restored

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Two things are hard on the heart, running up stairs,
and running down people...(see Eph. 4:29)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus prays for His disciples, "I pray for them. I am not praying for the world,
but for those You have given me, for they are Yours. All I have is Yours, and 
all you have is mine. And glory has come to Me through them... (Jn.17:9, 10) NIV


Our Thought for Today:

Have you ever given any thought to what Jesus meant when He said, "They are My glory".

God's glory is the revelation of His character and presence...

The lives of Jesus' disciples reveal His character, and He is present to the world through them.

What does your life reveal to those around you???

Does your live reveal Jesus' character and presence???

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly father, I pray that Your likeness would be visible in my life...
Forgive me for drifting away from your presence, Help me to remain steadfast
in Your will...Bless all my e-mail friends today...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will guide your way...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Have you ever given any thought to what Jesus meant when He said, "They are My glory". God's glory is the revelation of His character and presence. The lives of Jesus' disciples reveal His character, and He is present to the world through them. What does your life reveal to those around you??? Does your live reveal Jesus' character and presence???

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to live as faithful disciples of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives be a reflection of Your glory, revealing the character and presence of our Savior to the world around us. Transform us, Lord, by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern Your perfect will and offer ourselves as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to You. Use us, O God, to be a light in the darkness and to bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever given any thought to what Jesus meant when He said, “They are My glory”? God's glory is the revelation of His character and presence. The lives of Jesus' disciples reveal His character, and He is present to the world through them. What does your life reveal to those around you? Does your life reveal Jesus' character and presence?
subject: Revealing Jesus' Character and Presence
verse_text: Jesus prays for His disciples, “I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those You have given me, for they are Yours. All I have is Yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to Me through them.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The best way to get even is to forget...
(see Lk. 6:35)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus continues to pray for His disciples, as His followers we are included...
"While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe by that name
You gave Me. None has been lost except the one doomed for destruction
so that Scriptures would be fulfilled...

I am coming to You now, but I say these things while I am still in the world,
so that 'they' (His followers) may have a full measure of My joy within them.
(Jn. 17:12-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus knew all along who would be the one to betray Him. Judas was the 
"one headed for destruction," who was lost because he betrayed Jesus
and never sought forgiveness...

Judas chose his own path and suffered the consequences, just as we will
if we chose not to seek forgiveness...

One of the most common themes of Jesus' teachings is 'joy'...

He wants us to be joyful--I think the saddest thing is to see Christians walk 
around with long faces...What kind of witness is that???

The key to immeasurable joy is living in intimate contact with Christ, 
the source of all joy...

If we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we will experience God's special 
care and protection and see the victory He brings even when defeat seems certain...

Do you want to be a better witness??? "SMILE"

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always have a smiley attitude
while witnessing for You. Help me to always have a Christ-like attitude.
Help me to go forth this week praising You...Amen.

Keep looking up, and your joy will be complete...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

SMILE GOD LOVES YOU!!!

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...People don't care how much you know
until they know how much you care...(see Phil. 2:3)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus continues to pray: "I have given them Your Word, and the world has hated them, 
for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world." (Jn 17:14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The world has actually hated Christians, since they have come to realize the one true God...

The reason the world hates Christians is because Christian values differ from the wold.

Because Christ's followers don't cooperate with the world by joining in on their sins,
they are living accusations against the world's immorality...

The world follows Satan's agenda, and Satan is the avowed enemy of Jesus and His people...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the ability to always avoid Satan's
sly tricks...Give me a discerning heart, that I may never stray from
the truth, so that I would always be a living example to each person 
I come into contact with...Amen.

Keep Looking Up, He is seeking faithful followers...
You're in the prayers of two who care....
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

The world follows Satan's agenda, and Satan is the avowed enemy of Jesus and His people.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, recognizing that the world has hated us because we do not conform to its ways, but rather strive to live according to Your holy will. Help us to resist the temptation to be conformed to this world, and instead, transform us by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern and do Your good, pleasing, and perfect will. May we remain steadfast in our devotion to You, even as the world seeks to draw us away. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.

GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought...Humor is to life what shock absorbers
are to automobiles...(see Pro. 17:22)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus continues to pray for His disciples, "Sanctify them by the truth, 
Your Word is truth." Jn. 17:17) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

A follower of Christ becomes pure and holy through believing the Word of God (Heb. 4:12).

He or she has already accepted forgiveness through Christ's sacrificial death (Heb. 4:12).

Yes daily application for God's Word will have a purifying effect on our minds and hearts...

Scripture points out sin, it motivates us to confess, it renews our relationship with Christ,
and it guides us back to the right path...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for the life changing power of Your Word...
I pray that I would always be sensitive to You Holy Spirit's working in my heart...
Awaken in me a greater hunger for Your Word, I pray ithese things in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His protection today...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

May Your Word penetrate our hearts, exposing sin and leading us to repentance, that we may walk in the light of Your love. We ask this in the name of our Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.

verse_text: Jesus continues to pray for His disciples, “Sanctify them by the truth, Your Word is truth.”

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...A man wrapped up in himself makes
a very small package...(see Pro. 18:2)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus continues with His prayer, "As You sent Me into the world, I have sent them 
into the world. For them I sanctify Myself, that they too may be truly sanctified." (Jn 17:18, 19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus didn't ask the Father to take believers out of the world, but instead to use them in the world.

Because Jesus gives us the command to go out into the world, we should not try to escape from
the world, nor should we avoid all relationships with non-Christians...

We are called to be the salt and light (Mt. 5:13-16), and we are to do the work that God sent us to do...

One of His greatest wishes is that we would be truly sanctified, in other words made truly holy...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, Going out into the world to minister to the
unbelieving seems like an awesome task, when we leave You out,
but all things are possible when we include You....Amen.

Keep looking up, and pray for His sanctifying power...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Jesus prays for all believers, "My prayer is not for them alone. I pray also for those who
will believe in Me through their message." (Jn. 17:20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The unity that Jesus is praying for is not organizational unity but spiritual unity...

His prayer is for all those who will follow Him, including you and others you know...

He also prayed for unity in (17:11), protection from the evil one (17:15), and holiness (17:17)...

I thank You for the assurance it brings that you truly love us.
I thank You for the confidence it gives that You care and are
watching over us and that we have protection from the evil one...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to bless you today...
You're in the prayers of Two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...It takes more to plow a field than merely turning 
it over in your mind. (see 1 Thess. 4:11, 12)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus is arrested, "Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck 
the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear. (the servants name was Malchus.) 

Jesus commanded Peter, "Put your sword away! Shall I not drink the cup the Father 
has given Me?" (Jn 18:10, 11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Trying to protect Jesus, Peter pulled a sword and wounded the high priest's servant.
But Jesus told Peter to put away his sword and allow God's plan to unfold...

At times it is tempting to take matters into our own hands, to force the issue.
Most often such moves lead to sin...

Instead, we must trust God to work out His plan. Think about it, if Peter had had his 
way, Jesus would not have went to the cross, and God's plan of redemption would
have been thwarted...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear heavenly Father, how great it is when we allow Your plans
to run the course. Help me Lord to be more patient, that I may
see Your plan unfold. Help me to put full trust in You. Forgive me
for my impatience and weak faith...Amen.

Keep looking up, put your trust in Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought...Men are like fish. Neither would get in trouble
if they would keep their mouth shut...(Pro. 21:23)

Our Meditation for Today:

Jesus before the High priest: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus 
about His disciple and His teaching. 

"I have spoken openly to the world," Jesus replied."I always taught in the synagogue, 
or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret. 
Why question Me? ask those who heard Me. Surely they know what I said." (Jn 18: 19-21) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus had been teaching, preaching, and healing. These were the three main aspects
of His ministry. 

Teaching showed Jesus' concern for understanding; preaching showed His concern
for commitment; and healing showed His concern for wholeness...His miracles of healing 
authenticated His teaching and preaching, proving He was from God...

Jesus is the authentic Christ--the Savior of the world...Everything He accomplished Him 
to be all that the Bible says He is...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, As I think about Jesus' ordeal and the humiliation that
He endured, the pain that he suffered that the whole world may have their sins 
forgive by the sacrifice that He made, it tugs at my heart. to think that He would
take my sins upon Himself for my redemption; it is hard to phantom such love.
and so I can only accept by faith this great gift and merely say thank You Lord...Amen.

Keep looking up, there is no friend like Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Through His ministry, He has shown us the way to understanding, commitment, and wholeness. Lord, may we heed His teachings, respond to His call, and experience the transformative power of Your healing. We trust in Your Son, the Savior of the world, and we give You all the glory. Amen.

GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...You can easily determine the caliber of a person by the
amount of opposition it takes to discourage him...(see Pro. 24:10)

Our Meditation for Today:

Then the Jews led Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman Governor.
By now it was early morning, and to avoid ceremonial uncleanness the Jews did 
not enter the palace; they wanted to be able to eat the Pass Over...

So Pilate came out to them and asked, "what charges are you bring against this 
man?"

"If He were not a criminal," they said, "we would not have handed Him over to you."
(Jn. 18:28-30) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

It is strange how these Jewish leaders were more concerned about their ceremonial
laws than the were about putting to death an innocent person...

They kept the ceremonial requirements of their religion while harboring murder and
treachery in their hearts...

When asked what the charges were, they couldn't even give an answer...

But is our sin any less, when we neglect to attend worship--or when we neglect to give
thanks, or when we neglect to give to the poor??? Didn't Jesus Himself say what-ever
you do onto the least of these you do to Me???

When we neglect to do these things we are really disobeying our Lord, We may not have 
outright murder in our heart...But being disobedient is the same as saying the Lord's will
is unimportant...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, cleanse my heart of all unrighteousness.
Help me to be more faithful...Restore a right heart in me, that I
may not sin against you...Bless all my e-mail friends and keep
them safe...

Keep looking up, bring your requests to Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

But is our sin any less, when we neglect to attend worship--or when we neglect to give thanks, or when we neglect to give to the poor??? Didn't Jesus Himself say whatever you do onto the least of these you do to Me??? When we neglect to do these things we are really disobeying our Lord, We may not have outright murder in our heart. But being disobedient is the same as saying the Lord's will is unimportant.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts heavy, for we too often neglect the weightier matters of Your law. We can be so consumed with the outward appearance of righteousness, while harboring sin and disobedience within. Forgive us for the times we have been more concerned with our own traditions and ceremonies than with loving You and loving our neighbor as ourselves. Help us to have eyes to see the innocent ones who suffer, and grant us the courage to stand up for justice and mercy, even when it is costly. May we ever seek to do Your will, not our own. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: It is strange how these Jewish leaders were more concerned about their ceremonial laws than they were about putting to death an innocent person. They kept the ceremonial requirements of their religion while harboring murder and treachery in their hearts. When asked what the charges were, they couldn't even give an answer. But is our sin any less, when we neglect to attend worship—or when we neglect to give thanks, or when we neglect to give to the poor??? Didn't Jesus Himself say, “Whatever you do to the least of these, you do to Me”? When we neglect to do these things, we are really disobeying our Lord. We may not have outright murder in our heart, but being disobedient is the same as saying the Lord's will is unimportant.
subject: Obedience Matters More than Ceremony

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...People know what you are by what they see,
not by what they hear. (See Mt. 5:16)

Our Meditation for Today:

Pilate asked Jesus, "Are you the king of the Jews?" Jesus answered, "Is that your
own idea, or did others talk to you about Me."

Pilate answered, Am I a Jew?" It was Your people and Your chief priest who handed
You over to me. What is it You have done?"

Jesus said, "My kingdom is not of this world. If it were My servant would fight to
prevent My arrest by the Jews. But now My kingdom is from another place. (Jn. 18:33-36) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Pilate asked Jesus a straight forward question, and Jesus answer clearly. Jesus is
a King, but whose Kingdom is not of this world.

There seems to be no question in Pilate's mind that Jesus spoke the truth and was 
innocent of any crime. It also seems apparent that while recognizing the truth, Pilate
chose to reject it.

It is a tragedy when we fail to recognize the truth. It is even a greater tragedy when 
we recognize the truth but fail to heed it.

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, Help me to always recognize the truth and then act upon it.
guide me in Your path of righteousness for Your name sake. Protect 
me from any and all doubts...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will guide you...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

If it were My servant would fight to prevent My arrest by the Jews. But now My kingdom is from another place."

Help us to recognize that His Kingdom is not of this world, but rather a spiritual Kingdom that transcends the earthly realm. May we not be like Pilate, who acknowledged the truth but failed to act upon it. Instead, grant us the wisdom and courage to embrace Your truth and live according to Your will. Guide us, Lord, that we may not be deceived by the allures of this world, but remain steadfast in our faith and obedience to You. Amen.

subject: The Truth Revealed, yet Rejected

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...People who try to whittle you down are only
trying to reduce you to their size...(see Lk. 6:22, 23a)

Our Meditation for Today:

"What is truth?" Pilate asked. With this he went out again to the 
Jews and said, "I find no basis for a charge against him." (Jn. 18:38) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Pilate was cynical; he thought that all truth was relative. To many government 
officials, truth was whatever the majority of people agreed with or whatever 
helped advance their personal power and political goal...

When there is no basis for truth, there is no basis for moral right or wrong.
Justice becomes whatever works or whatever helps those in power...

In Jesus and His Word we have a standard for truth and for our moral behavior...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word, for Your Word is Truth, 
sanctify me in Your truth. Continue to guide me in all truth, that I might be
a better witness for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, for all truth comes from Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Have a blessed weekend!!!

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that in this world, truth is often obscured or distorted. Like Pilate, many seek to determine truth based on personal gain or popular opinion, rather than on the eternal, unchanging Word that You have revealed. Lord, we pray that You would open our eyes to see the truth found in Jesus Christ, the Way, the Truth, and the Life. May we cling to Your perfect and righteous standards, and not be swayed by the shifting sands of human wisdom. Guide us, Lord, to walk in the light of Your truth. Amen.

subject: Discover True Justice in Christ

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Quite often when a man thinks his mind is getting broader,
It's only his conscience stretching...(see Titus 1:15)

Our Meditation for Today:

The Jews insisted, "We have a law, and according to that law he must die,"
because he claimed to be the Son of God."

When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid, and he went back inside
the palace."Where do you come from?" he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave 
him no answer.

"Do you refuse to speak to me?" Pilate said."Don't you realize I have the 
power either to free you or to crucify you?"

Jesus answered, "You would have no power over Me if it were not given to
you from above. Therefore the one who handed Me over to you is guilty of
a greater sin." (Jn. 19:8-11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Throughout the trail we see that Jesus was in control, not Pilate or the religious leaders.

Throughout the trial Pilate wavered in his opinion of Jesus, the Jewish leaders reacted 
out of hatred and anger, but Jesus remained composed. He knew the truth, He knew God's
plan, and He knew the reason for His trial...

Despite the pressure and the persecution, Jesus remained unmoved. It was really Pilate 
and the religious leaders who were on trial, not Jesus....

If you are ever questioned or ridiculed because of your faith, remember that while you may 
be on trial before your accusers, they are on trial before God...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I am so thankful that I have never been ridiculed for my faith,
but if the time ever comes when I am, I pray that I would remain faithful no matter what
the consequences. I pray that I would remember what You went through for Me...Amen.

Keep looking up, for strength in times of trial and tribulation...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Temper is what gets most of us in trouble.
Pride is what keeps us there...(see Pro. 16:18, 19)

Our Meditation for Today:

In vs. 11 Jesus assured Pilate that he had no power over Him were it not 
given to him from above...

From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jews kept on shouting,
"If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to 
be a king opposes Caesar."

When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge's 
seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic" is Gabbatha) 
(Jn. 19:12, 13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These words spoken by the Jews pressured Pilate into allowing Jesus to be
crucified. As the Roman Governor of the area, Pilate was expected to keep
the peace...

Because Rome could not afford to keep large numbers of troops in the outlying
regions, they maintained control by crushing rebellions immediately with brute
force...

Pilate was afraid that reports to Caesar of insurrection in his region would cost him 
his job and perhaps even his life...

When we face a tough decision, we can take the easy way out, or we can stand up
for what is right regardless of the cost. If we know the good we ought to do and
don't do it, we sin (James 4:17)...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always make the right decisions,
and not take the easy way out. Help me to always stand up for what
is right no matter what the cost. Bless and keep my e-mail friends
safe, let no temptation befall them that is uncommon to man...Amen.

Keep looking up, we have no truer friend then Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

We pray that You would guide us, strengthen us, and empower us to be faithful witnesses for Your Kingdom. Amen.

verse_text: In vs. 11 Jesus assured Pilate that he had no power over Him were it not given to him from above. From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jews kept on shouting, “If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.” When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge's seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic“ is Gabbatha).

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...We make a living by what we get, we make
a life by what we give...(see Acts 20:35).

Our Meditation for Today:

It was the day of preparation of Passover Week, about the sixth hour.
"Here is your king," Pilate said to the Jews.

But they shouted, "Take him away! Take Him away! Crucify him!"

Shall I crucify your king?" Pilate asked.

"We have no king but Caesar," the chief priests answered...(Jn 19:14, 15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The Jewish leaders were so desperate to get rid of Jesus that, despite their 
intense hatred for Rome, they shouted "We have no king but Caesar."

How ironic that they claimed that their allegiance was to Rome, rejecting their 
own Messiah! Their own words condemned them, for God was to be their only 
true King, and they had abandoned every trace of loyalty to Him...

The priests had truly lost their reason for existence, instead of turning people to God,
they claimed allegiance to Rome in order to kill the Messiah...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the strength to always remain faithful to You.
I pray that at the end times when the persecution of all believers takes place, 
I would not go with the crowd, but that I would remain in the light...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will return one day as He said He would...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

The priests had truly lost their reason for existence, instead of turning people to God, they claimed allegiance to Rome in order to kill the Messiah.
original_verse_text: It was the day of Preparation of the Passover; it was about noon. “Here is your king,” Pilate said to the Jews. But they shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!” “Shall I crucify your king?” Pilate asked. “We have no king but Caesar,” the chief priests answered.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts, for the people of that day rejected Your Son, the true King, in favor of the earthly ruler. Help us to never make that same mistake, to always remain loyal and obedient to You alone, the rightful Sovereign over all. May we never forsake our allegiance to You, the one true God, in pursuit of worldly power or influence. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to recognize Your Son as our Savior and King. Amen.
reflection: The Jewish leaders were so desperate to get rid of Jesus that, despite their intense hatred for Rome, they shouted, “We have no king but Caesar.” How ironic that they claimed that their allegiance was to Rome, rejecting their own Messiah! Their own words condemned them, for God was to be their only true King, and they had abandoned every trace of loyalty to Him. The priests had truly lost their reason for existence; instead of turning people to God, they claimed allegiance to Rome in order to kill the Messiah.
subject: Rejecting the True King, Embracing Caesar

GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Our days are identical suitcases, all the same size, but some 
people can pack more into them than others...(see Eph. 5:15, 16)

Our Meditation for Today:

Finally Pilate handed Him over to them to be crucified. 
so the soldiers took charge of Jesus...

Carrying His own cross, He went out to the place of the 
Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha). Here they 
crucified him, and with Him two others, one on each side 
and Jesus in the middle.

Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross.
It read: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE 
JEWS...(Jn.19:16-19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Yes He was crucified, the most horrible death that was ever afflicted
upon another human being

The sign that Pilate had placed about Jesus' head, read, JESUS OF 
NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS, was meant to be a mockery.

A king stripped nearly naked and executed in public view, would seemingly
cause most to believe that He had lost His kingdom forever...

BUT Jesus, who turns the worlds wisdom upside down, was just coming into
His Kingdom. His death and resurrection would strike the deathblow to 
Satan's rule and would establish Jesus' eternal authority over the earth...

Few people reading the sign that bleak afternoon understood it's real meaning,
but the sign was absolutely true...

All was not lost. Jesus was King of the Jews, and the Gentiles, and of the 
whole world...Have you accepted Him as your king???

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, It is hard to phantom the kind of love You showed
the day You took my place on the cross...May my love for You be evident
each and every day...Amen.

Keep looking up and keep plugging away for Jesus...
You're in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Lord, help us to truly accept Jesus as our King and to live under His loving rule. May we find comfort and hope in the truth that all is not lost, for Your Son has conquered sin and death. original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Living would be easier if men showed as much patience 
at home as they do when they are fishing...(see 1 Pet. 3:7b)

Our Meditation for Today:

When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took His clothes, divided them into
four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This
garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom...

"Let's not tear it," they said to one another.""Let's decide by lot who will get it."
This happened that the scriptures might be fulfill which said,

"They divided my garments among them,
and cast lots for my clothing."

So this is what the soldiers did... (Jn 19:23, 24) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Roman soldiers in charge of the crucified customarily took for themselves
the clothes of the condemned men...

They divided Jesus' clothing, throwing dice to determine who would get His
seamless garment, the most valuable piece of clothing. This fulfilled the prophecy 
in Ps. 22:18.

Are you gambling away your eternal life, by saying "one day" when I get older?
What will happen if the Lord calls before you get any older?

What happens is, you will spend eternity separated from the Lord...

Isa. 55:6 tells us : Seek the Lord while He may be found;
call upon Him while He is near... 

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, I do not wish to gamble away the home 
You have prepared for those who are faithful and just.
Forgive me all my sins, and wash me white as snow.
Guide me in paths of righteousness, for Your name 
sake...Amen.

Keep look up, keep plugging away for Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Some people succeed because they are destined to, but most people 
succeed because they are determined to...(see Eph. 6:13, 14a)

Our Meditation for Today:

Near the cross of Jesus stood His mother, His mother's sister, Mary the wife of
Clopas, and Mary Magdalene...When Jesus saw His mother there, and the 
disciple whom He loved standing nearby, He said to His mother, "Dear woman,
here is your son," and to the disciple, "here is your mother." From that time on,
this disciple took her into his home...(Jn. 19:25-27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Even while He was dying on the cross, Jesus was concerned about His family.
He instructed John to care for Mary, His mother...

Our families are precious gifts from God, and we should value and care for them
under all circumstances...

Neither Christian work nor key responsibilities in any job or position excuse us
from caring for our families...

As you finish your morning devotion, take some time to plan something special
that you can do for your family today...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Lord, forgive me for not considering my family as precious as I should.
Often I place job, and material things at a higher priority than my family, not
necessarily by choice but by the busyness of scheduling. Help me to always
put them on my priority list, right below You...Amen.

Keep looking up, never allow the busyness of 
the day cause you to neglect God and family...
You're in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the precious gift of family. Even in His darkest hour, Your Son Jesus showed His love and concern for His mother, entrusting her to the care of His disciple John. Help us, like Jesus, to value and cherish our own families, putting their needs before our own. May we demonstrate genuine affection and honor for our loved ones, as Your Word instructs. Guide us to serve and support our families, both in times of joy and in times of sorrow. Amen.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...A man is rich according to what he is, 
not according to what he has...(see Pro. 13:7)

Our Meditation for Today:

When He had received the drink, Jesus said, "It is finished."
With that He bowed His head and gave up His spirit. (Jn. 19:30)

Our Thought for Today:

Until this time a complicated system of sacrifices had atoned for sins...

Sin separates people from God, and only through the sacrifice of an animal,
a substitute, could people be forgiven and become clean before God...

But people sin continually, so frequent sacrifices were required. Jesus however, 
became the final and ultimate sacrifice for sin...

The word (finished) Is the same as (paid in full). Jesus came to finish God's 
work of salvation (Jn. 4:34; 17:4) to pay the full penalty for our sins...

With His death, the complex sacrificial system ended because Jesus took all 
sin upon Himself. Now we can freely approach God because of what Jesus did for us...

Those who believe in Jesus' death and resurrection can live eternally with God and
escape the penalty that comes from sin...

If you have not as of yet personally accepted what Christ did for you on the cross,
you could be playing Russian Roulette with your life...

Let us seek the Lord while He may be found; let us call upon Him while He is near.
Le us forsake our evil ways and thoughts. Let us turn to the Lord and He will have 
mercy us, and our God will freely pardon...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, the creator of all that exists, seen and unseen,
create in me a pure and loving spirit, that I may not sin against thee...Amen.

Keep looking up, keep plugging away for Jesus...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Jesus came to finish God's work of salvation (John 4:34; 17:4) to pay the full penalty for our sins. With His death, the complex sacrificial system ended because Jesus took all sin upon Himself. Now we can freely approach God because of what Jesus did for us. Those who believe in Jesus' death and resurrection can live eternally with God and escape the penalty that comes from sin. prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, grateful for the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Through His death on the cross, He has paid the full penalty for our sins, ending the complex system of sacrifices and allowing us to freely approach You. We thank You for Your unfailing love and the gift of eternal life that comes through faith in Jesus. May we seek You diligently, forsake our evil ways, and find Your mercy and pardon. Amen.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...The difference between ordinary and
extraordinary is that little extra. (see Eccl. 9:10)

Our Meditation for Today:

Now it was the day of Preparation, and the next day was to be a special Sabbath.
Because the Jews did not want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath,
they asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken down.

The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been
crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.

But when they came to Jesus and found that He was already dead, they did not 
break His legs...(Jn. 19:31-33) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

It was against God's law to leave the body of a dead person exposed overnight (see
Deut. 21:23), and it was also against the law to work after Sundown on Friday, when
the Sabbath began...

This is why the religious leaders urgently wanted to get Jesus' body down off the cross
and buried by sundown...

Now these Roman soldiers had lots of experience from many previous crucifixions, so
they knew when a man was dead or alive. So they did not need to break His legs. The
reason for the breaking of the legs was so they could not hold themselves up, because
when they could no longer hold themselves up death came by suffocation in just minutes...

Jesus went through this ordeal so that our sins would be paid in full--That is why He said
"It is finished." There was no longer any need for the sacrifice of animals or anything else.

Jesus' shed blood was sufficient for all time...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again I am reminded of Your wonderful love.
I thank You for the assurance of my salvation through faith in Your finished
work on the cross. Forgive me for my sin's of thought, word, and deed. Help
me to walk in the paths of righteousness, for Jesus sake Amen...

Keep looking up, He is the light of the world...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!...(food for thought)...Swallowing angry words is much better 
than having to eat them...(see Pro. 29:11)

Our Meditation for Today:

These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: "Not one of His bones
will be broken," and as another scripture says "They will look on the one they have 
pierced." (Jn. 19:36, 37) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The graphic details of Jesus' death are especially important in John's 
record because he was an eye witness...

Jesus died as the lambs for the Passover meal were being slain. Not
a bone was to be broken in these sacrificial lambs, as we see by Ex. 12:46.

Jesus, the Lamb of God, was the perfect sacrifice for the sins of the whole
world...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, The thought of the suffering Your Son was 
willing to endure in my place, is much more than I can understand.
My prayer is that I would be willing to accept any persecution that
may come my way as a result of being a Christian...Amen.

Keep looking up, for the strength to remain faithful...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and awe, for Your Son, Jesus, is the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world. Just as the Passover lambs were to be without blemish, we give thanks that Jesus, the perfect sacrifice, was crucified without a single bone being broken. May we never forget the graphic yet profound truth that Jesus died in our place, that through His sacrifice we may be forgiven and redeemed. We praise You, Lord, for this wondrous gift of salvation. Amen.

Not a bone was to be broken in these sacrificial lambs, as we see in Exodus 12:46. Jesus, the Lamb of God, was the perfect sacrifice for the sins of the whole world.
subject: Witness the Lamb's Sacrifice for the World
